episode_title: 621 - The One Where Ross Meets Elizabeth’s Dad

content.description: Central Perk, Phoebe, Rachel, Chandler, and Monica are there. Rachel is reading everyone’s horoscope.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, Chandler!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And your horoscope says, “On the fifth a special someone is going to give you a gift.”

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, well thank you in advance. (Kisses her.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Op, but the twelfth brings a lover’s spat.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You are going to make a joke about my special present! Why would you do that?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, wait and on the nineteenth a secret crush announces itself.
(Phoebe winks and licks her lips while eyeing Chandler.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey guys!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God! It’s Joey Tribbiani of Mac and C.H.E.E.S.E.!!!!!!!
(Everyone claps and cheers, Joey mimics looking about with a gun.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh that’s right. It’s your first day! So are you psyched to fight fake crime with your robot sidekick?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Am I psyched? The lead in my own TV series? I’ve dreamed about this for years! Why have I not been preparing?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No! Joey, you’re going to be great!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: But I got to act with a robot Pheebs, and-and I don’t know anything about technology! I can’t even use Chandler’s computer except to find porn! And-and that’s only ‘cause it’s right there when you turn it on!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I think our lover’s spat will start a little early this month.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’ll be waiting.
content.parenthetical: in a sexy voice to Chandler

content.description: Central Perk, time lapse. Phoebe is now looking at the covers of two different books.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Are you judging them by their covers? Because you’re really not supposed to do that.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, I’m just deciding which one to use—I’m gonna start writing another book!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Be-because the last one was such a big seller?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, if you must know I have written 14 books. And as I am the only one who has read them, I can tell you that they all have been very well received.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What are you guys doing later?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, Rachel and I have appointments to get our hair cut.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: We do?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I want to see what he wants first.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I just found out that Elizabeth’s dad wants to meet me.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Wait a minute, hold the phone! You’re not Elizabeth’s dad?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Come on guys, I-I really want this guy to like me. It-it would really help me out if you guys were here to make me look good.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Of course we’ll help! Yeah! We’ll be here!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thanks!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We know how tough those parent/teacher conferences can be.

content.description: Pier 59 Studios, it’s the set of Mac and C.H.E.E.S.E. The producer is showing Joey around the set.

content.speaker: The Producer
content.text: So uh, here’s your office set!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wow! Huh? (Picks up the phone) Mac Macaveli, Private Investigator!

content.speaker: The Producer
content.text: Let’s get you into wardrobe for a fitting.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay. Hey uh, when do I get to meet the robot?

content.speaker: The Producer
content.text: I’m sorry, why don’t we do that right now? He’s right here. (Points to a guy.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: The Producer
content.text: Joey Tribbiani, this is…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh wow! He’s so lifelike! (Starts touching the guy’s cheeks) Unbelievable! (He starts tugging on the guy’s ears.

content.speaker: The Producer
content.text: This is Wayne, the man who created and operates C.H.E.E.S.E.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: How do you do there, Wayne? (Backs away.)

content.speaker: The Producer
content.text: I’ll let you two guys get acquainted, huh? (Walks away.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay. Sorry about that…(Mimics that cheek thing he just did.) Uh, so where’s C.H.E.E.S.E.?

content.speaker: Wayne
content.text: C.H.E.E.S.E. is right here. (He puts on his headset, picks up the controller, and wheels C.H.E.E.S.E. in. C.H.E.E.S.E. is just a plain old robot on tracks; he kinda looks like No. 5 in the movie Short Circuit .)

content.speaker: C.H.E.E.S.E.
content.text: Nice to meet you Mac!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: This is like the temporary robot, right?

content.speaker: Wayne
content.text: No. Why?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, I-I just, I just it was going to be like a really cool robot, y’know? Like the terminator or uh, when I first saw you.

content.speaker: Wayne
content.text: I spent two years developing this machine, it’s absolutely state of the art.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m sorry, it just—I don’t know it doesn’t really look like it can do anything.

content.speaker: Wayne
content.text: It can do this. (He moves C.H.E.E.S.E.’s arm close to Joey’s special area and he jumps back.)

content.description: [Scene: Central Perk, Ross is at the counter drinking coffee as Elizabeth enters with her dad, Paul. Elizabeth goes to kiss Ross, but he just kisses her on the forehead. By the way Paul is played by Bruce Willis. Yes, that Bruce Willis from Moonlighting, Die Hard, and Armageddon.]

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: This is my father, Paul Stevens. Dad, this is Ross Geller.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It-it’s great to meet you Paul.

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: I usually prefer Elizabeth’s boyfriends to address me as Mr. Stevens.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Of course, of course, Mr. Stevens.

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: So Ross, what your problem?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Eh-wh—Excuse me?

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Why can’t you get a girlfriend your own age?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s funny. Umm… (Pause, then serious) It’s not funny.

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: I don’t like you going out with my daughter Ross.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay. I can, I can see that. Umm, but I think if you give me umm, one chance I can, I can change your mind.

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Okay. I’ll give you one chance to change my mind. (Ross laughs in relief) You got one minute. (Ross suddenly gets worried.)

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Daddy!

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Fine! Two minutes. Go.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: This is—you—(Ross starts laughing.)

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: 1 minute 50 seconds.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, umm I want you to know that I have never done anything like this before. I mean, I mean I’ve been in um, relationships in general, uh but I have never done it with a student—I mean I not—not it ! I mean, I mean I don’t—We haven’t done it . Uh, I mean, I mean, we’ve-we’ve-we’ve done stuff. (Paul is not amused.) Okay, okay, a joke, a joke—lighten the mood. Umm, two guys go into a bar. One of them is Irish.

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: I’m Irish.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And the Irish guy wins the joke!
(Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe enter.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ross!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ross!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How crazy that we’d run into you!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh God, thank you! (Runs and gives all of them a group hug.) Umm, uh, Mr. Stevens I’d like you to meet my friends uh, this is Phoebe, Monica, and Chandler.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You’re Elizabeth’s father, huh? I can see now where she gets her rugged handsomeness.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Is-is-is there a-a Mrs. Stevens?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: There’s a Mr. Bing!

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: No, unfortunately Lizzie’s mom passed away shortly after she was born. I raised her by myself.

content.speaker: Phoebe and Monica
content.text: Ohh!

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: I get that a lot.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay umm, why don’t we all take a seat, y’know? And uh, and I’ll get us all some uh some coffees—(He goes to pull out Elizabeth’s chair, but Paul steps in)—Yeah, why don’t you. (Paul pulls out her chair) Uh and you guys can talk about whatever, whatever you want. Y’know? Whatever pops into your head. (He turns his back to Paul and Elizabeth and points to himself for Chandler, Monica, and Phoebe. Then he goes to order the coffee.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know, it is so strange seeing Ross here this time of day, ‘cause usually he’s got the children’s hospital.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah. Not looking for dates. (Monica turns in horror.)

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: So uh, Monica is Ross’s sister.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: And he’s a great brother!

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: I had a sister.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ohh!

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: She passed away.

content.speaker: Monica and Phoebe
content.text: Ohh!

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Oh, you don’t have to do that every time.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: But uh Ross, Ross is a great guy! I was roommates with him in college. Uh, funny story… (He starts laughing then notices that Paul isn’t happy.) You’re roommate in college died didn’t he?

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: A part of him did yes.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay here we are Paul, Elizabeth. (He sets down their cups.) So I hope you guys were finding something to talk about.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, we were just…
(Rachel runs in.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi, I’m sorry I’m late but I am ready, ready to talk you up! When does Liz’s father get here?

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: I’m already here.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh! Ross is sooo great!

content.description: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe’s, Phoebe is working on her book at the kitchen table, Monica is on the couch, and Chandler is entering from the bathroom carrying a package of toilet paper.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey honey, you got the kind with the little girl, you said we were gonna to get the kind with the baby.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, you said the baby creeps you out.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, the little girl creeps me out.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You said the baby.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why would the baby creep me out?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why would the little girl creep you out?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You guys, I’m sorry, could you please talk a little slower?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: This is going in your book?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, it’s about relationships. Y’know? The traps, the pitfalls, what not to do, keep going. This stuff is great!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?! Excuse me!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: And how none of it matters when the people really love each other. (Chandler and Monica kiss.) And how people will believe anything you tell them as long as it’s a compliment.

content.description: Central Perk, Rachel is there alone as Paul enters.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh hi!

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Hi! Hi. (He’s looking around.) I think I left my keys here somewhere.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh! Well let’s look for them. (Finds some under one of the couch cushions. It has a pink, fuzzy ball on the key chain.) Oh-oh-hey! Are these them?

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right! (Throws them back under the cushion.)

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Oh, here they are right here. (Picks them up from underneath the corner of the couch.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh good.

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Thanks for your help. (Starts to leave.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, wait! Sorry, Mr. Paul? Mr. Paul?

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Just call me Paul.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Paul. Umm, I just wanted you to know that Ross really is a great guy.

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Well maybe you can date him then that would save me the trouble of killing him. (Rachel laughs then starts looking at him.) Are you okay?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You just don’t look old enough to have a twenty-year-old daughter.

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Well, we were very young when we had her.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh. We?

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Well yeah, it usually, it takes two people to… (He taps his index fingers together.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh no! Yes! Of course, I know that! I just—I meant y’know are you still a ‘We’ or are you just ‘You?’

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: I’m just me, my wife died shortly after Lizzie was born.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh. So you raised her all on your own?

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Yes I did.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh. (She touches his arm for support and likes what she feels) Ooh!

content.description: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe’s, Phoebe is still writing in her book, Chandler and Monica are in the kitchen as Joey enters.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How was your first day?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Pretty great! Except I did get a little attitude from the robot.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Damn those robots, they’re supposed to be our faith ful servants!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Anyway, it wasn’t the robot, it was the guy who controls him. Yeah, he doesn’t like me. He had C.H.E.E.S.E. knock over the sandwich right when I was reaching for one! Ohh!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, why don’t you just get him fired?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I may have to, I hate to do it, but I’m the star! Y’know? There’s a limit to how many sandwiches I can eat off the floor. (His cell phone rings) Excuse me. (Answers it, on phone) Joey Tribbiani.

content.speaker: Estelle
content.text: Joe! I’m glad I found ya, I got an audition for ya!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wow!

content.speaker: Estelle
content.text: The thing is it’s kinda on the Q.T. The actor who has the part doesn’t know he might be fired. It’s the lead in a series, Mac and C.H.E.E.S.E.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m the lead in Mac and C.H.E.E.S.E.!!

content.speaker: Estelle
content.text: Uh-oh!

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Ross is entering looking for Joey, but instead he finds Paul and Rachel making out on the couch.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Joey?!

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Hi Ross.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I was just getting him to like you.

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, scene is continued from earlier.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Joey?! Joey!! (He runs into his bedroom.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross, Joey is not here.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, I’ll just wait for him in here!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross, it’s okay. You can come out.

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Yeah Ross it’s okay, it’s me, Mr. Stevens.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh! Oh my God! I didn’t even see you!

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Sure you did! You came in, you got all awkward, and you ran into the bedroom. You were shouting, “Joey! Joey!” Bye Rach. (Kisses her.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Bye!

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: I’ll call you later. Bye Ross. (Leaves)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What-what-what the—how da-how did-what the-how did-what?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, y’know he lost his keys so he was looking for them…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: In your mouth?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No! Downstairs! And we got to talking y’know, for like two hours, and I really liked him so I invited him up here for a cup of coffee.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You were at the coffee house !

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross, what’s the big deal? So I kissed the guy!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: He is my girlfriend’s father, okay? It’s-it’s, it’s weird!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wh—You dated my sister!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That was different!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What? Why?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: This is weird for me !

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross look, look this is good for you. Okay? Let’s face it, so far the guy’s not lovin’ ya! But I can turn that around! I got the inside track! We can all go out to dinner, y’know? And I can talk you up! Ross, the guy is a very, very successful lawyer!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: How is that important?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh it’s important!

content.description: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe’s, Joey is telling everyone about his impending termination at Mac and C.H.E.E.S.E.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Apparently, there’s like a million guys out there that can play Mac, and there’s only this one robot and this one guy who controls it! I didn’t know he could get me fired! What am I going to do?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well y’know Joey, you’re a pretty charming guy.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Thanks, but I kinda have a problem to deal with here.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No sweetie, you’ve got to win over the guy that controls C.H.E.E.S.E.! You’ve got to kiss some serious robot ass!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s not a bad idea. Yeah. Okay, but if I got to turn on the charm tomorrow I’m not wasting anymore of it over here with you guys. (Starts to leave, but stops and turns to Phoebe.) Well, actually I got a little bit saved for you Pheebs. (Exits.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So do you think uh, Joey’s more charming than me?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah! That’s why I’m sleeping with him on the side.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, you wish. (Stops to think about it and gets depressed.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: “You wish.”

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe, stop writing about us!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m not writing about you! I’m writing about other people.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Who?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Marcia and Chester.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay fine! Fine! Then you know what, I’ll just write about Phyllis! Hmm!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hmm.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phyllis is sitting in a chair.
content.parenthetical: writing on a piece of paper

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I see what you’re doing!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phyllis sees what I’m doing.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh-oh.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh, I have tasted my own medicine and it is bitter!

content.description: Pier 59 Studios, Joey is walking up to C.H.E.E.S.E. and Wayne.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Morning! Hey, how’s my favorite genius and my little robot buddy?! (Pats C.H.E.E.S.E. on the head.)

content.speaker: Wayne
content.text: Don’t touch him!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay! (He yanks his hand away.) All right. Umm, all right Wayne, level with me. Okay? I-I keep hearing all these rumors that I might get fired. Okay, they even have actors coming in to read for my part! Come on man, you-you got to give me a second chance! I mean, I love-I love this little guy! (He grabs C.H.E.E.S.E.’s arm and pulls it off at the elbow.) Ah-ah!! (Wayne is shocked.) Okay, that’s why you didn’t want me to touch him right? Here you go! Okay? (Hands Wayne the arm and he goes to fix it. Meanwhile Joey starts to berate himself.) Stupid! I can’t believe it! God! (A very beautiful woman walks by.) (To her) Hey, how you doin’? (He and her go over to talk and Wayne looks on with envy.)

content.description: A Restaurant, Ross and Rachel are on their double date. Rachel is busy talking Ross up.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So it seemed that my prom date had stood me up, so Ross selflessly, offered to take me.

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: What a nice story!

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: So Ross was in college and decided to jump at the chance to take a young girl to her high school prom.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow! I definitely did not see that one backfiring! I’m gonna go to the bathroom.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, take your time.
(Rachel heads for the bathroom.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Just-just so you know I was a freshman and she was a senior. So it wasn’t as bad as-as…

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Ross, look, I know I’ve been giving you a lot of jabs and it’s partly because I’m very protective of Lizzie, and partly because well, they just keep coming to me. But I have to admit that after all the wonderful things that Lizzie has told me and the many, many, (pause) many stories that Rachel has told me that, well (pause) you’re not (pause) all bad.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Not all bad.

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: And anyhow, I’m sorry I was so harsh before, but you have to understand that I (pause) still look at Lizzie like she’s a twelve-year-old girl.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah. You know what? I know what you mean; I do that too.

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: I beg your pardon?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No! No! Not—I don’t mean I-I see her as a twelve-year-old girl! I mean I-I have a son, who’s umm six and I still think of him as a baby.

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: You have a son?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, well my-my ex-wife and I share custody of Ben and umm, uh, and just so you know, Carol and I are on excellent terms as I’m sure you are with your wife! (Realizes) Oh, I’m sorry! (To Elizabeth) It’s unbelievable!

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Don’t worry about it, I just didn’t realize you were married. (Rachel returns and hears that.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh we were, but that was just a (pause as the audience reacts), I mean that was just a big drunken mistake.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You’re back.

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: You two were married?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh! Whoops! I’m sorry, you were talking about Emily!
(Ross slams his head down on the table.)

content.description: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe’s, Monica and Chandler are entering and they’re arguing.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler, we said we would meet at the coffeehouse at six.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We said seven!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We said six!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: The only way that I said six would be if the seven’s, let meet at seven, not at six.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah and if I had seven, maybe I would’ve said something like this, “Wow! My boyfriend’s such a wise ass—seven!”

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh my good God.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ugh!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I know what time you said.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well actually, I know what time Chester and Marcia said.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What time?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Quite an interesting turn of events, suddenly it’s my book to the rescue, huh? (Reading her book) Ooh, very interesting. Yeah, well this certainly clears things up.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What does it say?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I will tell you as soon as you thank me for writing my book.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Thank you for writing your book. Its-its uh, great book and you are the queen of everything.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Thanks! So are you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I told you I should not wear this color. (He’s wearing a reddish-orange sweater.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Mon… (Pause as she restarts) Marcia and Chester are planning on seeing a movie on Sunday night. Marcia thinks they’re supposed to meet at six, Chester thinks it’s at seven.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So you knew we were gonna miss the movie!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That’s right.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Inside of telling us you decided to write in your stupid book!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Marcia and Chester are mad at Phyllis.

content.description: Joey’s Dressing Room, Joey and Chandler are there.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I can’t believe I’m going to lose this job!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh I’m so sorry man! Is there anything I can do?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah! Help me get this mini-fridge past the security guard.
(There’s a knock on the door and Joey answers it to Wayne.)

content.speaker: Wayne
content.text: Hey Joey, I want to talk to you.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah? Well, I don’t want to talk to you Wayne! I hate you! You ruined my life! Oh, Chandler, Wayne. Wayne, Chandler. (They shake hands.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hi, how are ya?

content.speaker: Wayne
content.text: Joey, Joey, I-I-I’ll g-get you your job back if you help me out.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Why should I help you?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: The reason he just said.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What do you need?

content.speaker: Wayne
content.text: I-I-I saw you on stage talking to that beautiful woman, y’know Sarah?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Wayne
content.text: I wish I could talk to her.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What are you in love with her or something?

content.speaker: Wayne
content.text: Yeah. Her. All of them. Anyone.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, I’ve been there my friend.

content.speaker: Wayne
content.text: Listen, I-I guarantee you keep your job if you can teach me how to talk to women like you do.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh wow Wayne, it’s not really something you can teach y’know? It’s pretty much something you’re born with if you—(Off Chandler’s look)—You-you can teach it! I’ll show you right how to do it.

content.description: A Restaurant, Rachel is still trying to talk up Ross, not to much success.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I mean if you think about it, I mean Ross did learn something from each marriage.

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: How to make the next one even shorter?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Now wait a minute that’s not fair. He was married to me a hell of a lot longer than he was married to Emily, he just didn’t tell me. (Everyone looks at her, Ross not happily.) Maybe I have to pee again. (Gets up to try to use the bathroom.)

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Well, this is fun. So Ross, did you kill any of these wives?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Y’know what? I-I-I… I-I have had enough of this! Y’know, I-I-I care a great deal about your daughter and I have treated her with nothing but respect! So if-if you’ve got a problem with me, frankly…

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Are you yelling at me?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: God no!

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Y’know what daddy? If you don’t like Ross, that’s fine. It doesn’t matter to me, I’m gonna go out with him anyway.

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Really?! (She nods in the affirmative.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well if it doesn’t matter to her, it doesn’t matter to me! (to Paul) Still not yelling!

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Wow. What can I say? (Pause, pointing at Ross) This doesn’t make me like you any better!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s okay, I’m not so crazy about myself right now either.

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Then we agree?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh yeah, I guess—Yeah! I guess so.

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Neither of us like Ross!

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: I like Ross.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ohhh! Kids!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wait-wait-wait, I just thought of another story about how nice Ross is!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s okay Rach, we’re not liking Ross right now.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh! I’ve got a lot of those too!

content.description: Mac’s Office, Mac is talking to C.H.E.E.S.E. about their case.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, it turns out you were right C.H.E.E.S.E.

content.speaker: C.H.E.E.S.E.
content.text: The shipment never made it through Omaha?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You got it! And the rabbi’s beard, 100% horsehair. Nice catch C.H.E.E.S.E.! (Pauses as he waits for C.H.E.E.S.E.’s next line.) It’s your line C.H.E.E.S.E.! (Suddenly C.H.E.E.S.E. goes crazy and starts flinging it’s arms and advancing on Joey behind the desk.) Wayne! Wayne!!

(The camera cuts to Wayne who’s busy making out with Sarah and rubbing C.H.E.E.S.E.’s controller on her back causing C.H.E.E.S.E. to go crazy. Joey starts throwing books at C.H.E.E.S.E. to get him to stop.)
